meanings.def: any of the hard parts that form the skeleton of the body of a human or an animal
examples: He survived the accident with no broken bones.
This fish has a lot of bones in it.
She went for a bone density scan.
The dog was gnawing at a bone.
She had a beautiful face with very good bone structure.
Her eyes were black in a face the colour of bleached bones.
She was diagnosed as having brittle bones.
The black and white photographs emphasized her fine bone structure.
The shock jarred every bone in his body.
the delicate bones of her face

meanings.def: the hard substance that bones are made of
examples: knives with bone handles

meanings.def: having bones of the type mentioned
examples: fine-boned

meanings.def: a very thin person or animal
examples: The cat hadn’t been fed for weeks and was just a bag of bones.
the bare bones of the story

meanings.def: a subject that causes people to disagree
examples: Where to go on holiday is always a bone of contention in our family.

meanings.def: so honest or clearly expressed that it is likely to cause offence to some people
examples: His comments about her size were a bit close to the bone.
Some of the sex scenes in the play were judged by critics to be too close to the bone.

meanings.def: to reduce something, such as costs, as much as you possibly can
examples: Their annual budget has already been pared to the bone.

meanings.def: to be certain about something even though you do not have any direct proof and cannot explain why you are certain
examples: I know I'm going to fail this exam—I can feel it in my bones.

meanings.def: to be angry with somebody about something and want to discuss it with them
very determined and refusing to give up
examples: When she sensed a good story she was like a dog with a bone.

meanings.def: to be honest and open about something; to not hesitate to do something
examples: She made no bones about telling him exactly what she thought of him.

meanings.def: to have none of the quality mentioned
examples: She was honest and hard-working, and didn't have an unkind bone in her body.

meanings.def: to develop a basic idea, etc. by giving more details to make it more complete
examples: The strength of the book is that it puts flesh on the bare bones of this argument.

meanings.def: extremely thin in a way that is not attractive or healthy
examples: The dog lost more and more weight, and was soon little more than skin and bone.
He's all skin and bone after his illness.

meanings.def: to give somebody a small part of what they want as a way of showing that you want to help them, without offering them the main thing they want
examples: She feels this new energy bill is just throwing a bone to the environmentalists.
His threats chilled her to the bone.
